greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 2*A065941 - A049310.
comment: Row sums = the Lucas numbers, A000032, starting (1, 3, 4, 7, 11,...). Generally, N*A065941 - (N-1)*A049310 = triangles with row sums = Fibonacci-like sequences starting (1, (N+1), (N+1+1),...). With N = 2, row sums of the triangle A131774 = (1, 3, 4, 7,...).
formula: 2*A065941 - A049310 as infinite lower triangular matrices.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 14 2007
